page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: In the centre of the village (Little Weighton) there are a number of very old cottages and houses, but most of the housing is modern and has been built within the last 40 years. There are many kinds of private housing,- detatched and semi-detatched houses and bungalows, as well as semi-detatched council-owned houses, making a total of nearly 300 dwellings altogether. There is no mains gas piped to the area so most houses use either oil or solid fuel (coal) for heating. All houses in our survey had mains electricity but this was used mainly for lighting and power rather than for heating. All houses in our survey had a garden and 60% of householders grew their own vegetables as well as flowers.
